intro: Lepidium argentinum var. stenocarpum, commonly known as the narrow-carpel wallflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments and has small, green, lobed leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or white and bloom in late spring or early summer. The fruit is a dry, segmented capsule that contains several seeds.
